title: Authors and Citation
text: Hiroyuki Tsuda. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tsuda H (2025). sistatica: Package (Title Case). R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/tsuda16k/sistatica.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sistatica: What the Package Does (Title Case)},   author = {Hiroyuki Tsuda},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/tsuda16k/sistatica}, }

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: 統計分析用のさまざまな関数を提供するパッケージです。 リファレンスページはこちら。https://tsuda16k.github.io/sistatica/

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: 以下の手順でインストールできます。 もしpakパッケージをまだインストールしていない場合ははじめにそれをインストールしてください。
code: install.packages("pak") pak::pak("tsuda16k/sistatica")

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(sistatica) ## basic example code

what: Omnibus test for the Friedman test (one-way repeated-measures, nonparametric) — friedmanOmni
title: Omnibus test for the Friedman test (one-way repeated-measures, nonparametric) — friedmanOmni
text: Runs one-way Friedman test using `rstatix::friedman_test()` returns tibble standardized schema.

title: Omnibus test for the Friedman test (one-way repeated-measures, nonparametric) — friedmanOmni
code: friedmanOmni(df, id = "id", group = "group", y = "y")

title: Omnibus test for the Friedman test (one-way repeated-measures, nonparametric) — friedmanOmni
text: df long-format data frame. id Name subject identifier column (character scalar). group Name within-subject condition column (character scalar). y Name dependent variable column (character scalar).

title: Omnibus test for the Friedman test (one-way repeated-measures, nonparametric) — friedmanOmni
text: tibble one row columns .

title: Omnibus test for the Friedman test (one-way repeated-measures, nonparametric) — friedmanOmni
text: analysis_method Analysis identifier string. Always `"friedman_test"`. effect_term Effect label schema alignment. Always `"group"`. test_statistic Friedman omnibus test statistic value (chi-square). test_statistic_type Test statistic type. Always `"chi_square"`. df1 Degrees freedom. df2 Reserved (always `NA_real_` test family). p_value Omnibus p-value. effect_size Effect size value (Kendall's W). effect_size_type Effect size type label. Always `"kendalls_W"`. effect_size_scale Effect size scale label. Always `"agreement"`. effect_size_ci_low Reserved effect size CI lower bound (currently `NA_real_`). effect_size_ci_high Reserved effect size CI upper bound (currently `NA_real_`).

title: Omnibus test for the Friedman test (one-way repeated-measures, nonparametric) — friedmanOmni
code: set.seed(21) n = 24 u = rnorm(n, 0, 0.25) w = data.frame(   id = factor(seq_len(n)),   A = rlnorm(n, meanlog = 3.8, sdlog = 0.25) * exp(u),   B = rlnorm(n, meanlog = 3.9, sdlog = 0.25) * exp(u),   C = rlnorm(n, meanlog = 4.0, sdlog = 0.25) * exp(u) ) d = tidyr::pivot_longer(w, cols = c(A, B, C), names_to = "group", values_to = "y") d$group = factor(d$group) friedmanOmni(d, id = "id", group = "group", y = "y") #> # A tibble: 1 × 12 #>   analysis_method effect_term test_statistic test_statistic_type   df1   df2 #>   <chr>           <chr>                <dbl> <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 friedman_test   group                 2.33 chi_square              2    NA #> # ℹ 6 more variables: p_value <dbl>, effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, #> #   effect_size_scale <chr>, effect_size_ci_low <dbl>, #> #   effect_size_ci_high <dbl>

what: Post hoc tests for the Friedman test (paired Wilcoxon + Holm p-values) — friedmanPost
title: Post hoc tests for the Friedman test (paired Wilcoxon + Holm p-values) — friedmanPost
text: Performs pairwise post hoc comparisons one-way Friedman design.

title: Post hoc tests for the Friedman test (paired Wilcoxon + Holm p-values) — friedmanPost
code: friedmanPost(   df,   id = "id",   group = "group",   y = "y",   alpha = 0.05,   pAdjust = "holm",   ciAdjust = c("bonferroni", "none") )

title: Post hoc tests for the Friedman test (paired Wilcoxon + Holm p-values) — friedmanPost
text: df long-format data frame. id Name subject identifier column (character scalar). group Name within-subject condition column (character scalar). y Name dependent variable column (character scalar). alpha Family-wise alpha used CI adjustment (default `0.05`). pAdjust P-value adjustment method multiple comparisons (default `"holm"`). Must accepted `stats::p.adjust()`. ciAdjust CI adjustment method. One `"bonferroni"` `"none"`.

title: Post hoc tests for the Friedman test (paired Wilcoxon + Holm p-values) — friedmanPost
text: tibble one row per pairwise contrast columns .

title: Post hoc tests for the Friedman test (paired Wilcoxon + Holm p-values) — friedmanPost
text: - Difference estimate CI: `stats::wilcox.test()` paired differences   (Hodges-Lehmann location shift + CI). - Adjusted p-values: `stats::p.adjust()` (default: Holm). - Effect size: rank-biserial r via `rstatix::wilcox_effsize()` (paired).

title: Post hoc tests for the Friedman test (paired Wilcoxon + Holm p-values) — friedmanPost
text: analysis_method Analysis identifier string. Always `"friedman_test"`. effect_term Effect label schema alignment. Always `"group"`. comparison_kind Comparison family label. Always `"pairwise"`. contrast_label Human-readable label, e.g., `"vs B"`. contrast_id Machine-readable id, e.g., `"group:|B"`. group1 First condition label. group2 Second condition label. center_type Summary location type condition. Always `"median"`. group1_center Median `y` `group1`. group2_center Median `y` `group2`. dispersion_type Summary dispersion type condition. Always `"iqr"`. group1_dispersion IQR `y` `group1`. group2_dispersion IQR `y` `group2`. n_group1 Number subjects non-missing values `group1`. n_group2 Number subjects non-missing values `group2`. n_total Number complete paired observations used contrast. difference_estimate Hodges-Lehmann location shift estimate (group1 - group2). difference_estimate_type Difference estimator label. Always `"hodges_lehmann_location_shift"`. difference_direction Difference direction label. Always `"group1_minus_group2"`. ci_low Lower bound CI `difference_estimate`. ci_high Upper bound CI `difference_estimate`. ci_level Confidence level used CI (possibly Bonferroni-adjusted). ci_adjustment CI adjustment label: `"bonferroni_adjusted"` `"unadjusted"`. test_statistic Wilcoxon signed-rank statistic value (V). test_statistic_type Test statistic type. Always `"wilcoxon_V"`. df1 Reserved (always `NA_real_` test family). df2 Reserved (always `NA_real_` test family). p_value Raw p-value paired Wilcoxon test. p_value_adjusted Multiplicity-adjusted p-value (via `pAdjust`). p_value_adjustment Adjustment label, e.g., `"holm_adjusted"`. effect_size Effect size value (rank-biserial r). effect_size_type Effect size type label. Always `"rank_biserial_r"`. effect_size_scale Effect size scale label. Always `"rank_based_r"`. effect_size_ci_low Reserved effect size CI lower bound (currently `NA_real_`). effect_size_ci_high Reserved effect size CI upper bound (currently `NA_real_`).

title: Post hoc tests for the Friedman test (paired Wilcoxon + Holm p-values) — friedmanPost
code: set.seed(22) n = 20 u = rnorm(n, 0, 0.25) w = data.frame(   id = factor(seq_len(n)),   A = rlnorm(n, meanlog = 3.7, sdlog = 0.25) * exp(u),   B = rlnorm(n, meanlog = 3.9, sdlog = 0.25) * exp(u),   C = rlnorm(n, meanlog = 4.0, sdlog = 0.25) * exp(u) ) d = tidyr::pivot_longer(w, cols = c(A, B, C), names_to = "group", values_to = "y") d$group = factor(d$group) friedmanPost(d, id = "id", group = "group", y = "y") #> Error in map(., .f, data, formula, method, ...): ℹ In index: 1. #> Caused by error in `required_package()`: #> ! coin package needed to be installed before using this function. Type this in R: install.packages('coin')

what: Omnibus test for the Kruskal-Wallis test (one-way, nonparametric) — kruskalOmni
title: Omnibus test for the Kruskal-Wallis test (one-way, nonparametric) — kruskalOmni
text: Runs one-way Kruskal-Wallis test using `rstatix::kruskal_test()` returns tibble standardized schema.

title: Omnibus test for the Kruskal-Wallis test (one-way, nonparametric) — kruskalOmni
code: kruskalOmni(df, group = "group", y = "y")

title: Omnibus test for the Kruskal-Wallis test (one-way, nonparametric) — kruskalOmni
text: df long-format data frame. group Name -subject group column (character scalar). y Name dependent variable column (character scalar).

title: Omnibus test for the Kruskal-Wallis test (one-way, nonparametric) — kruskalOmni
text: tibble one row columns .

title: Omnibus test for the Kruskal-Wallis test (one-way, nonparametric) — kruskalOmni
text: analysis_method Analysis identifier string. Always `"kruskal_wallis_test"`. effect_term Effect label schema alignment. Always `"group"`. test_statistic Kruskal-Wallis omnibus test statistic value (chi-square). test_statistic_type Test statistic type. Always `"chi_square"`. df1 Degrees freedom. df2 Reserved (always `NA_real_` test family). p_value Omnibus p-value. effect_size Effect size value (epsilon-squared). effect_size_type Effect size type label. Always `"epsilon_squared"`. effect_size_scale Effect size scale label. Always `"rank_based_variance_explained"`. effect_size_ci_low Reserved effect size CI lower bound (currently `NA_real_`). effect_size_ci_high Reserved effect size CI upper bound (currently `NA_real_`).

title: Omnibus test for the Kruskal-Wallis test (one-way, nonparametric) — kruskalOmni
code: data("PlantGrowth") d = PlantGrowth d$group = factor(d$group) names(d) = c("y","group") kruskalOmni(d, group = "group", y = "y") #> # A tibble: 1 × 12 #>   analysis_method     effect_term test_statistic test_statistic_type   df1   df2 #>   <chr>               <chr>                <dbl> <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 kruskal_wallis_test group                 7.99 chi_square              2    NA #> # ℹ 6 more variables: p_value <dbl>, effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, #> #   effect_size_scale <chr>, effect_size_ci_low <dbl>, #> #   effect_size_ci_high <dbl>

what: Post hoc tests for the Kruskal-Wallis test (Dunn p-values + Wilcoxon HL CIs) — kruskalPost
title: Post hoc tests for the Kruskal-Wallis test (Dunn p-values + Wilcoxon HL CIs) — kruskalPost
text: Performs pairwise post hoc comparisons Kruskal-Wallis test.

title: Post hoc tests for the Kruskal-Wallis test (Dunn p-values + Wilcoxon HL CIs) — kruskalPost
code: kruskalPost(   df,   group = "group",   y = "y",   alpha = 0.05,   pAdjust = "holm",   ciAdjust = c("bonferroni", "none") )

title: Post hoc tests for the Kruskal-Wallis test (Dunn p-values + Wilcoxon HL CIs) — kruskalPost
text: df long-format data frame. group Name -subject group column (character scalar). y Name dependent variable column (character scalar). alpha Family-wise alpha used CI adjustment (default `0.05`). pAdjust P-value adjustment method multiple comparisons (default `"holm"`). Passed `rstatix::dunn_test()` recorded output. ciAdjust CI adjustment method. One `"bonferroni"` `"none"`.

title: Post hoc tests for the Kruskal-Wallis test (Dunn p-values + Wilcoxon HL CIs) — kruskalPost
text: tibble one row per pairwise contrast columns .

title: Post hoc tests for the Kruskal-Wallis test (Dunn p-values + Wilcoxon HL CIs) — kruskalPost
text: - Adjusted p-values: `rstatix::dunn_test()` (default: Holm). - Difference estimate CI: `stats::wilcox.test()` groups   (Hodges-Lehmann location shift + CI). - Effect size: rank-biserial r via `rstatix::wilcox_effsize()` (unpaired).

title: Post hoc tests for the Kruskal-Wallis test (Dunn p-values + Wilcoxon HL CIs) — kruskalPost
text: analysis_method Analysis identifier string. Always `"kruskal_wallis_test"`. effect_term Effect label schema alignment. Always `"group"`. comparison_kind Comparison family label. Always `"pairwise"`. contrast_label Human-readable label, e.g., `"vs B"`. contrast_id Machine-readable id, e.g., `"group:|B"`. group1 First group label. group2 Second group label. center_type Summary location type group. Always `"median"`. group1_center Median `y` `group1`. group2_center Median `y` `group2`. dispersion_type Summary dispersion type group. Always `"iqr"`. group1_dispersion IQR `y` `group1`. group2_dispersion IQR `y` `group2`. n_group1 Number non-missing observations `group1`. n_group2 Number non-missing observations `group2`. n_total Total observations used contrast (`n_group1 + n_group2`). difference_estimate Hodges-Lehmann location shift estimate (group1 - group2). difference_estimate_type Difference estimator label. Always `"hodges_lehmann_location_shift"`. difference_direction Difference direction label. Always `"group1_minus_group2"`. ci_low Lower bound CI `difference_estimate`. ci_high Upper bound CI `difference_estimate`. ci_level Confidence level used CI (possibly Bonferroni-adjusted). ci_adjustment CI adjustment label: `"bonferroni_adjusted"` `"unadjusted"`. test_statistic Dunn test statistic value (Z). test_statistic_type Test statistic type. Always `"dunn_Z"`. df1 Reserved (always `NA_real_` test family). df2 Reserved (always `NA_real_` test family). p_value Raw p-value Dunn test. p_value_adjusted Multiplicity-adjusted p-value Dunn test. p_value_adjustment Adjustment label, e.g., `"holm_adjusted"`. effect_size Effect size value (rank-biserial r). effect_size_type Effect size type label. Always `"rank_biserial_r"`. effect_size_scale Effect size scale label. Always `"rank_based_r"`. effect_size_ci_low Reserved effect size CI lower bound (currently `NA_real_`). effect_size_ci_high Reserved effect size CI upper bound (currently `NA_real_`).

title: Post hoc tests for the Kruskal-Wallis test (Dunn p-values + Wilcoxon HL CIs) — kruskalPost
code: set.seed(30) d = data.frame(   group = factor(rep(c("A","B","C"), each = 20)),   y = c(rlnorm(20, 3.8, 0.3), rlnorm(20, 3.9, 0.35), rlnorm(20, 4.1, 0.4)) ) kruskalPost(d, group = "group", y = "y") #> Error in map(., .f, data, formula, method, ...): ℹ In index: 1. #> Caused by error in `required_package()`: #> ! coin package needed to be installed before using this function. Type this in R: install.packages('coin')

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling `rhs(lhs)`.

what: Omnibus test for repeated-measures ANOVA (rm-ANOVA) — rmOmni
title: Omnibus test for repeated-measures ANOVA (rm-ANOVA) — rmOmni
text: Runs one-way repeated-measures ANOVA using `rstatix::anova_test()` returns tibble standardized (method-agnostic) schema.

title: Omnibus test for repeated-measures ANOVA (rm-ANOVA) — rmOmni
code: rmOmni(   df,   id = "id",   group = "group",   y = "y",   correction = c("auto", "GG", "HF", "none") )

title: Omnibus test for repeated-measures ANOVA (rm-ANOVA) — rmOmni
text: df long-format data frame. id Name subject identifier column (character scalar). group Name within-subject condition column (character scalar). y Name dependent variable column (character scalar). correction Sphericity correction passed `rstatix::get_anova_table()`. One `"auto"`, `"GG"`, `"HF"`, `"none"`. - `"auto"`: apply GG sphericity violated. - `"GG"`: report Greenhouse-Geisser corrected dfs/p-values (applicable). - `"HF"`: report Huynh-Feldt corrected dfs/p-values (applicable). - `"none"`: report uncorrected dfs/p-values.

title: Omnibus test for repeated-measures ANOVA (rm-ANOVA) — rmOmni
text: tibble one row (within-subject factor) columns .

title: Omnibus test for repeated-measures ANOVA (rm-ANOVA) — rmOmni
text: function intentionally designed *one-way* within-subject factor. output fixes `effect_term = "group"` keep consistent schema across multiple omnibus/post-hoc methods.

title: Omnibus test for repeated-measures ANOVA (rm-ANOVA) — rmOmni
text: analysis_method Analysis identifier string. Always `"repeated_measures_anova"`. effect_term Effect label schema alignment. Always `"group"`. test_statistic Omnibus test statistic value (F). test_statistic_type Omnibus test statistic type. Always `"F"`. df1 Numerator degrees freedom omnibus F-test (possibly corrected). df2 Denominator degrees freedom omnibus F-test (possibly corrected). p_value Omnibus p-value (possibly corrected). effect_size Omnibus effect size value (generalized eta-squared; GES). effect_size_type Effect size type label. Always `"generalized_eta_squared"`. effect_size_scale Effect size scale label. Always `"variance_explained"`. effect_size_ci_low Reserved effect size CI lower bound (currently `NA_real_`). effect_size_ci_high Reserved effect size CI upper bound (currently `NA_real_`).

title: Omnibus test for repeated-measures ANOVA (rm-ANOVA) — rmOmni
code: set.seed(1) n = 20 u = rnorm(n, 0, 4) w = data.frame(   id = factor(seq_len(n)),   u  = u,   A  = 50 + u + rnorm(n, 0, 5),   B  = 55 + u + rnorm(n, 0, 5),   C  = 60 + u + rnorm(n, 0, 5) ) d = tidyr::pivot_longer(w, cols = c(A, B, C), names_to = "group", values_to = "y") d$group = factor(d$group) rmOmni(d, id = "id", group = "group", y = "y", correction = "auto") #> # A tibble: 1 × 12 #>   analysis_method     effect_term test_statistic test_statistic_type   df1   df2 #>   <chr>               <chr>                <dbl> <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 repeated_measures_… group                 28.2 F                       2    38 #> # ℹ 6 more variables: p_value <dbl>, effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, #> #   effect_size_scale <chr>, effect_size_ci_low <dbl>, #> #   effect_size_ci_high <dbl> rmOmni(d, id = "id", group = "group", y = "y", correction = "GG") #> # A tibble: 1 × 12 #>   analysis_method     effect_term test_statistic test_statistic_type   df1   df2 #>   <chr>               <chr>                <dbl> <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 repeated_measures_… group                 28.2 F                    1.95  37.1 #> # ℹ 6 more variables: p_value <dbl>, effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, #> #   effect_size_scale <chr>, effect_size_ci_low <dbl>, #> #   effect_size_ci_high <dbl>

what: Post hoc tests for repeated-measures ANOVA (paired t-tests) — rmPost
title: Post hoc tests for repeated-measures ANOVA (paired t-tests) — rmPost
text: Performs pairwise paired t-tests one-way repeated-measures design returns tibble standardized (method-agnostic) post-hoc schema.

title: Post hoc tests for repeated-measures ANOVA (paired t-tests) — rmPost
code: rmPost(   df,   id = "id",   group = "group",   y = "y",   alpha = 0.05,   pAdjust = "holm",   ciAdjust = c("bonferroni", "none") )

title: Post hoc tests for repeated-measures ANOVA (paired t-tests) — rmPost
text: df long-format data frame. id Name subject identifier column (character scalar). group Name within-subject condition column (character scalar). y Name dependent variable column (character scalar). alpha Family-wise alpha used CI adjustment (default `0.05`). pAdjust P-value adjustment method multiple comparisons (default `"holm"`). Must accepted `stats::p.adjust()`. ciAdjust CI adjustment method. One `"bonferroni"` `"none"`.

title: Post hoc tests for repeated-measures ANOVA (paired t-tests) — rmPost
text: tibble one row per pairwise contrast columns .

title: Post hoc tests for repeated-measures ANOVA (paired t-tests) — rmPost
text: - Adjusted p-values: via `stats::p.adjust()` (default: Holm). - Confidence intervals: unadjusted Bonferroni-adjusted confidence level. - Effect size: Cohen's d paired samples (dz practice) via `rstatix::cohens_d()`.

title: Post hoc tests for repeated-measures ANOVA (paired t-tests) — rmPost
text: analysis_method Analysis identifier string. Always `"repeated_measures_anova"`. effect_term Effect label schema alignment. Always `"group"`. comparison_kind Comparison family label. Always `"pairwise"`. contrast_label Human-readable label, e.g., `"vs B"`. contrast_id Machine-readable id, e.g., `"group:|B"`. group1 First condition label (maps first element pair). group2 Second condition label (maps second element pair). center_type Summary location type condition. Always `"mean"`. group1_center Mean `y` `group1`. group2_center Mean `y` `group2`. dispersion_type Summary dispersion type condition. Always `"sd"`. group1_dispersion Standard deviation `y` `group1`. group2_dispersion Standard deviation `y` `group2`. n_group1 Number subjects non-missing values `group1`. n_group2 Number subjects non-missing values `group2`. n_total Number complete paired observations used contrast. difference_estimate Estimated mean difference (group1 - group2). difference_estimate_type Difference estimator label. Always `"mean_difference"`. difference_direction Difference direction label. Always `"group1_minus_group2"`. ci_low Lower bound CI `difference_estimate`. ci_high Upper bound CI `difference_estimate`. ci_level Confidence level used CI (possibly Bonferroni-adjusted). ci_adjustment CI adjustment label: `"bonferroni_adjusted"` `"unadjusted"`. test_statistic Paired t-test statistic value (t). test_statistic_type Test statistic type. Always `"t"`. df1 Degrees freedom t-test. df2 Reserved (always `NA_real_` test family). p_value Raw (unadjusted) p-value pairwise t-test. p_value_adjusted Multiplicity-adjusted p-value (via `pAdjust`). p_value_adjustment Adjustment label, e.g., `"holm_adjusted"`. effect_size Effect size value (Cohen's dz). effect_size_type Effect size type label. Always `"cohens_dz"`. effect_size_scale Effect size scale label. Always `"standardized_mean_difference"`. effect_size_ci_low Reserved effect size CI lower bound (currently `NA_real_`). effect_size_ci_high Reserved effect size CI upper bound (currently `NA_real_`).

title: Post hoc tests for repeated-measures ANOVA (paired t-tests) — rmPost
code: set.seed(2) n = 18 u = rnorm(n, 0, 3) w = data.frame(   id = factor(seq_len(n)),   u  = u,   A  = 10 + u + rnorm(n, 0, 2),   B  = 11 + u + rnorm(n, 0, 2),   C  = 13 + u + rnorm(n, 0, 2) ) d = tidyr::pivot_longer(w, cols = c(A, B, C), names_to = "group", values_to = "y") d$group = factor(d$group) rmPost(d, id = "id", group = "group", y = "y") #> # A tibble: 3 × 35 #>   analysis_method  effect_term comparison_kind contrast_label contrast_id group1 #>   <chr>            <chr>       <chr>           <chr>          <chr>       <chr>  #> 1 repeated_measur… group       pairwise        A vs B         group:A|B   A      #> 2 repeated_measur… group       pairwise        A vs C         group:A|C   A      #> 3 repeated_measur… group       pairwise        B vs C         group:B|C   B      #> # ℹ 29 more variables: group2 <chr>, center_type <chr>, group1_center <dbl>, #> #   group2_center <dbl>, dispersion_type <chr>, group1_dispersion <dbl>, #> #   group2_dispersion <dbl>, n_group1 <int>, n_group2 <int>, n_total <int>, #> #   difference_estimate <dbl>, difference_estimate_type <chr>, #> #   difference_direction <chr>, ci_low <dbl>, ci_high <dbl>, ci_level <dbl>, #> #   ci_adjustment <chr>, test_statistic <dbl>, test_statistic_type <chr>, #> #   df1 <dbl>, df2 <dbl>, p_value <dbl>, p_value_adjusted <dbl>, …

what: Omnibus test for Welch one-way ANOVA — welchOmni
title: Omnibus test for Welch one-way ANOVA — welchOmni
text: Runs one-way Welch ANOVA (heteroscedastic ANOVA) using `rstatix::welch_anova_test()` returns tibble standardized schema.

title: Omnibus test for Welch one-way ANOVA — welchOmni
code: welchOmni(df, group = "group", y = "y")

title: Omnibus test for Welch one-way ANOVA — welchOmni
text: df long-format data frame. group Name -subject group column (character scalar). y Name dependent variable column (character scalar).

title: Omnibus test for Welch one-way ANOVA — welchOmni
text: tibble one row columns .

title: Omnibus test for Welch one-way ANOVA — welchOmni
text: omnibus effect size computed approximation: $$\eta^2 \approx \frac{df_1 F}{df_1 F + df_2}$$ \(F\) Welch statistic \(df_1, df_2\) approximate degrees freedom returned Welch test.

title: Omnibus test for Welch one-way ANOVA — welchOmni
text: analysis_method Analysis identifier string. Always `"welch_anova"`. effect_term Effect label schema alignment. Always `"group"`. test_statistic Welch omnibus test statistic value (F). test_statistic_type Test statistic type. Always `"F"`. df1 Approximate numerator degrees freedom. df2 Approximate denominator degrees freedom. p_value Omnibus p-value. effect_size Approximate eta-squared computed F dfs. effect_size_type Effect size type label. Always `"eta_squared_approx"`. effect_size_scale Effect size scale label. Always `"variance_explained"`. effect_size_ci_low Reserved effect size CI lower bound (currently `NA_real_`). effect_size_ci_high Reserved effect size CI upper bound (currently `NA_real_`).

title: Omnibus test for Welch one-way ANOVA — welchOmni
code: set.seed(10) d = data.frame(   group = factor(rep(c("G1","G2","G3"), each = 25)),   y = c(rnorm(25, 50, 5), rnorm(25, 55, 12), rnorm(25, 60, 7)) ) welchOmni(d, group = "group", y = "y") #> # A tibble: 1 × 12 #>   analysis_method effect_term test_statistic test_statistic_type   df1   df2 #>   <chr>           <chr>                <dbl> <chr>               <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 welch_anova     group                 23.6 F                       2  44.6 #> # ℹ 6 more variables: p_value <dbl>, effect_size <dbl>, effect_size_type <chr>, #> #   effect_size_scale <chr>, effect_size_ci_low <dbl>, #> #   effect_size_ci_high <dbl>

what: Post hoc tests for Welch one-way ANOVA (Games-Howell p-values + Welch t-test CIs) — welchPost
title: Post hoc tests for Welch one-way ANOVA (Games-Howell p-values + Welch t-test CIs) — welchPost
text: Performs pairwise comparisons appropriate heteroscedastic one-way designs.

title: Post hoc tests for Welch one-way ANOVA (Games-Howell p-values + Welch t-test CIs) — welchPost
code: welchPost(   df,   group = "group",   y = "y",   alpha = 0.05,   ciAdjust = c("bonferroni", "none") )

title: Post hoc tests for Welch one-way ANOVA (Games-Howell p-values + Welch t-test CIs) — welchPost
text: df long-format data frame. group Name -subject group column (character scalar). y Name dependent variable column (character scalar). alpha Family-wise alpha used CI adjustment (default `0.05`). ciAdjust CI adjustment method. One `"bonferroni"` `"none"`.

title: Post hoc tests for Welch one-way ANOVA (Games-Howell p-values + Welch t-test CIs) — welchPost
text: tibble one row per pairwise contrast columns .

title: Post hoc tests for Welch one-way ANOVA (Games-Howell p-values + Welch t-test CIs) — welchPost
text: - Adjusted p-values: `rstatix::games_howell_test()` (Games-Howell). - Difference estimate CI: `stats::t.test(var.equal = FALSE)` pair. - Effect size: Hedges' g via `rstatix::cohens_d(hedges.correction = TRUE)`.

title: Post hoc tests for Welch one-way ANOVA (Games-Howell p-values + Welch t-test CIs) — welchPost
text: analysis_method Analysis identifier string. Always `"welch_anova"`. effect_term Effect label schema alignment. Always `"group"`. comparison_kind Comparison family label. Always `"pairwise"`. contrast_label Human-readable label, e.g., `"G1 vs G2"`. contrast_id Machine-readable id, e.g., `"group:G1|G2"`. group1 First group label (maps first element pair). group2 Second group label (maps second element pair). center_type Summary location type group. Always `"mean"`. group1_center Mean `y` `group1`. group2_center Mean `y` `group2`. dispersion_type Summary dispersion type group. Always `"sd"`. group1_dispersion Standard deviation `y` `group1`. group2_dispersion Standard deviation `y` `group2`. n_group1 Number non-missing observations `group1`. n_group2 Number non-missing observations `group2`. n_total Total observations used contrast (`n_group1 + n_group2`). difference_estimate Estimated mean difference (group1 - group2). difference_estimate_type Difference estimator label. Always `"mean_difference"`. difference_direction Difference direction label. Always `"group1_minus_group2"`. ci_low Lower bound CI `difference_estimate` (Welch t-test). ci_high Upper bound CI `difference_estimate` (Welch t-test). ci_level Confidence level used CI (possibly Bonferroni-adjusted). ci_adjustment CI adjustment label: `"bonferroni_adjusted"` `"unadjusted"`. test_statistic Welch t statistic value pair. test_statistic_type Test statistic type. Always `"t"`. df1 Approximate df Welch t-test pair. df2 Reserved (always `NA_real_` test family). p_value Raw p-value Welch t-test pair. p_value_adjusted Games-Howell adjusted p-value pair. p_value_adjustment Adjustment label. Always `"games_howell_adjusted"`. effect_size Effect size value (Hedges' g). effect_size_type Effect size type label. Always `"hedges_g"`. effect_size_scale Effect size scale label. Always `"standardized_mean_difference"`. effect_size_ci_low Reserved effect size CI lower bound (currently `NA_real_`). effect_size_ci_high Reserved effect size CI upper bound (currently `NA_real_`).

title: Post hoc tests for Welch one-way ANOVA (Games-Howell p-values + Welch t-test CIs) — welchPost
code: set.seed(11) d = data.frame(   group = factor(rep(c("G1","G2","G3","G4"), each = 20)),   y = c(rnorm(20, 0, 1), rnorm(20, 0.3, 2), rnorm(20, 1.0, 1.2), rnorm(20, 0.6, 3)) ) welchPost(d, group = "group", y = "y") #> # A tibble: 6 × 35 #>   analysis_method effect_term comparison_kind contrast_label contrast_id group1 #>   <chr>           <chr>       <chr>           <chr>          <chr>       <chr>  #> 1 welch_anova     group       pairwise        G1 vs G2       group:G1|G2 G1     #> 2 welch_anova     group       pairwise        G1 vs G3       group:G1|G3 G1     #> 3 welch_anova     group       pairwise        G1 vs G4       group:G1|G4 G1     #> 4 welch_anova     group       pairwise        G2 vs G3       group:G2|G3 G2     #> 5 welch_anova     group       pairwise        G2 vs G4       group:G2|G4 G2     #> 6 welch_anova     group       pairwise        G3 vs G4       group:G3|G4 G3     #> # ℹ 29 more variables: group2 <chr>, center_type <chr>, group1_center <dbl>, #> #   group2_center <dbl>, dispersion_type <chr>, group1_dispersion <dbl>, #> #   group2_dispersion <dbl>, n_group1 <int>, n_group2 <int>, n_total <int>, #> #   difference_estimate <dbl>, difference_estimate_type <chr>, #> #   difference_direction <chr>, ci_low <dbl>, ci_high <dbl>, ci_level <dbl>, #> #   ci_adjustment <chr>, test_statistic <dbl>, test_statistic_type <chr>, #> #   df1 <dbl>, df2 <dbl>, p_value <dbl>, p_value_adjusted <dbl>, …
